component: A label that may be associated with an input component Label com.sun.rave.web.ui.Label Use this attribute to specify the labeled component. The attribute is only relevant if the component to be labeled is not a child of the ui:label tag. The value of the attribute should be the id of the component relative to the label, not the DOM ID of the rendered HTML element. Input Component for java.lang.String false The identifier of the component associated with this label Style level for this label, where lower values typically specify progressively larger font sizes, and/or bolder font weights. Valid values are 1, 2, and 3. The default label level is 2. Any label level outside this range will result in no label level being added. Style Level labelLevel int 2 true Determines the style of the label (default is 2, 1 is the strongest) Flag indicating that the labeled component should be marked as required. It is only relevant if the labeled component is not a child of the label tag. Set this flag to ensure that the required icon shows up the first time the page is rendered. Required Field Indicator requiredIndicator boolean true Indicate that the component associated with this label is required Flag indicating that the required and invalid icons should not be shown with this label, even though the labeled component is required. Hide the Required and Invalid icons hideIndicators boolean true Do not show required and invalid indicators for the component The label text to be displayed for this label. This attribute can be set to a literal string, to a value binding expression that corresponds to a property of a managed bean, or to a value binding expression that corresponds to a message from a resource bundle declared using f:loadBundle.
